title: Short-Intensive Course for Improving Self-Regulated Learning and Motivation in Nursing Students

context.prior_knowledge: Requirement of intermediate theoretical background and practical experience
context.additional_context: Learners possess intermediate expertise in language domains and engage in real-time online classes using digital devices. Learning effectiveness is monitored through a formative assessment-driven feedback system

learning_goals: Utilize self-regulated learning strategies (e.g., goal setting, time management, self-reflection) at over 80% proficiency
Improve intrinsic value and self-efficacy by over 20% based on MSLQ (Motivated Strategies for Learning Questionnaire) criteria
Develop and implement study plans applying cognitive strategies (e.g., note-taking, concept mapping)
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
